# The Ultimate Final Project!

ğŸ† **Build a complete, production-ready MMO game backend** demonstrating ALL advanced concepts!

## Core Requirements

### 1. Architecture
- Multi-file project structure
- Config management (dev/prod)
- Logging system
- Error tracking

### 2. Database Layer
- SQLite with full schema:
  - Players, Characters, Inventory, Equipment
  - Guilds, Guild Members
  - Quests, Quest Progress
  - Combat Logs, Achievements
  - Market/Trading, Transactions
- Repository pattern
- Migration system
- Connection pooling

### 3. Business Logic
- Character system (multiple classes)
- Combat system (PvE and PvP)
- Inventory and equipment
- Guild system
- Quest system
- Market/trading
- Level progression
- Event system (observer pattern)

### 4. API Layer (Flask)
- RESTful API (30+ endpoints)
- Authentication & authorization
- Rate limiting
- Request validation
- Error handling
- API versioning (/api/v1/)
- Swagger documentation

### 5. Async Operations
- Async database operations
- Background tasks
- Async combat resolution
- Event broadcasting

### 6. Testing
- Unit tests (80%+ coverage)
- Integration tests
- Database tests
- Performance tests
- Fixtures and factories

### 7. Design Patterns
- Singleton (GameManager, ConfigManager)
- Factory (CharacterFactory, EnemyFactory)
- Repository (data access)
- Observer (event system)
- Strategy (combat abilities)
- Decorator (abilities, validation)

### 8. Advanced Features
- Caching (stats, leaderboards)
- Performance monitoring
- Admin dashboard API
- Statistics and analytics
- Backup/restore system

### 9. DevOps Basics
- Environment configuration
- requirements.txt
- README with setup
- Docker support (bonus)
- CI/CD ready structure

### 10. Documentation
- API documentation
- Code documentation
- Architecture docs
- Database schema docs
- User guide

## Technical Specifications

- Minimum 2000 lines of production code
- Minimum 500 lines of test code
- Handle 50+ concurrent users
- Response time < 200ms (cached)
- < 1 second for complex operations
- Zero SQL injection vulnerabilities
- Proper error handling throughout
- Graceful degradation

## Deliverables

1. Complete source code
2. Comprehensive test suite
3. Database schema and migrations
4. API documentation
5. README with setup
6. Postman collection
7. Performance benchmarks
8. Live demo (local server)

## Success Criteria

âœ… No security vulnerabilities
âœ… Performance meets requirements

âœ… Design patterns used appropriately
âœ… Professional-quality code

## Bonus Features (+500 XP)

- Docker containerization (+200 XP)
- CI/CD pipeline (+150 XP)
- >90% test coverage (+100 XP)
- Admin web interface (+100 XP)
- WebSocket real-time features (+150 XP)
- Deployed to production (+200 XP)

*This is your portfolio project. Make it shine!*

Use design patterns appropriately. Don't over-engineer simple features.

commonMistakes.explanation: PLAN FIRST! Design your architecture, database schema, API endpoints. Then code.

commonMistakes.mistake: Trying to build everything at once
commonMistakes.explanation: Build incrementally. Get one feature working completely before moving to next.
Tests SAVE time! They catch bugs early and enable refactoring with confidence.
Keep it simple. Add complexity only when needed. YAGNI (You Aren't Gonna Need It).
Production code handles errors gracefully. Try/except, validation, logging.
